context.p: In certain circumstances, a member can request a plan change. See RMO Processing Plan Change Guideline On or Off Marketplace for details about when plan changes are allowed.

sectiondiv.title: Customer Advocates: Do not use this procedure.

ul.li: If an off Exchange member calls requesting a plan change, direct the member to apply for the new plan through the Retail Shopping Cart (RSC).
If the member prefers to send in a paper application, direct them to the website for their state (www.bcbsxx.com) to download a paper application.
If the member insists that you send a paper application, create a Dashboard Service Request (SR) activity for ICSS (queue UHUENRO).

sectiondiv.title: Processors: Do not use this procedure to change a Texas member's policy.
sectiondiv.p: If a plan change request for a Texas policy is accidentally routed to your queue, reroute it to U312344.

context.p: Use this procedure to change an Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, or Oklahoma member's policy in VMS.

prereq.p: This procedure uses two VMS windows. You need to know how to switch between open windows in Windows.

step.cmd: In the VMS menu bar, click the icon for opening a second window, and log into VMS in the second window (Window Two).

info.note: Throughout the rest of this procedure, the first window -- the one you started in -- is called Window One and the second window -- the one you opened in this step -- is called Window Two.
The procedure will tell you when to switch windows. After you switch to a window, do the following steps in that window until the procedure tells you to switch again.

step.cmd: Switch to Window One.
In the VMS menu bar, click Profiles, and then click Members.
In the Member ID field, type the member's ID number, and then click Do Search.
Click the member ID. The member tree screen opens.
Switch to Window Two.
In the VMS menu bar, click Processing, and then click Customer Service.
In the Inquiry Reason field, select Plan Change (Downgrade).

info.note: Use Plan Change (Downgrade) even if the change is actually an increase in coverage.

step.cmd: In the Entity ID field, type the member's ID number.
Click Accept. The system displays a list of the matching members.
In the Matching Members section, click the ID of the member whose plan you are changing. The member tree window opens.
In the member tree, right-click on the coverage that the member wants to replace.
In the shortcut menu, click Cancel. The Member Termination window opens.
In the Termination Date field, type the date that is one day before the new plan's effective date.

info.note: If the plan change is retroactive to the existing plan's effective date, set the Termination Date field to the existing plan's effective date.

step.cmd: Beside the Term Reason Code field, click the magnifying glass icon.
In the Termination Reasons Search window, click Do Search.
From the Termination Reasons list, select a reason for the policy termination.
Click Return ID.
In the Member Termination window, click Modify & Exit.
step.stepresult: The Termination Reasons Search window closes.

step.cmd: Switch to Window One.
In the Display InActive? list, click Yes.
Click Do Search.
Right-click on the cancelled policy, and then click View.
Switch to Window Two.
In the Display InActive? field, click Yes.
Click Do Search.
In the member tree, right-click on the Line of Business (LOB) that the member wants to add.
Click Add. The Eligibility Coverage Add window opens.
Perform the following in the Eligibility Coverage Add window:

substep.cmd: Effective Date: Set to the effective date of the new plan.
Product Effective Date: Set to the same date as Effective Date.
LOB: This autofills to the LOB you right-clicked on in the previous step. If it did not, select the LOB that the member wants to add.
Original Effective Date: Set to the same value as on the member's previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Plan Strategy ID: Enter the Plan Strategy ID for the member's new plan.

info.note: If the new plan's Plan Strategy ID is not specified in the SR activity you are working from, see RMO Plan Strategy ID and Class of Contract Code - Overview for a complete list of plan strategy IDs cross-referenced with plan names and class of contract codes.

substep.cmd: Bill Flag: Set to the same value as on the member's previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Coverage Code: Set to the same value as on the member's previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
COBRA Flag: Leave the default No (N).
COBRA A/R Type: Leave the default Group (G).
Manual Enrollment: Change to Yes.

step.cmd: Click Add and Exit.
If the member has dependents on the account, a dialog window will appear asking whether you want to set the new coverage in place for all the dependents. Leave the value set to Yes and click Submit.
In the Display InActive? field, click Yes, and then click Do Search.
Switch to Window One.
In the Eligibility Coverage View window, click Exit.
In the Display InActive? field, click Yes.
Click Do Search.
Right-click the member's name.
Hover over Drill Down.
Click Ancillary Coverage Info.
Right-click the terminated Ancillary Coverage Record.
Click View.
Switch to Window Two.
Right-click the member's name.
Hover over Drill Down.
Click Ancillary Coverage Info.
Right-click Ancillary Coverage Records.
Click Add. The Coverage Ancillary Add screen displays.
In the Coverage Ancillary Add screen, perform the following:

substep.cmd: LOB: Click the appropriate LOB from the list.
Effective Date: Type the coverage effective date.
Termination Date Required Type 12/31/9999.

Case Number: Type the member's ID number followed by the current date in the format ymmdd. For example, if you are working with member number 887766554, and you are making a plan change on February 25, 2024, you would use 88776655440225.
Claims Investigation: Leave blank.
Pre Existing End Date: Leave blank.
Application Received Date: Type the date on which the request to change the plan was received.
Application Signature: Type the date on which the request to change the plan was received.
Member Issue Date: Type today's date (mm/dd/yyyy).
Conversion Switch Date: Leave blank
Control Number: Leave blank.
Application Type: Click New (N).
External Business: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Source Type: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
External Ref#: If the External Business field is marked Yes, this field must be completed. Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Proxy Sign Ind: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Proxy Sign Date: If the Proxy Sign Ind field is marked Yes, this field must be completed. Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Market Type: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Variant Code: Click the Variant Code that corresponds to the last two digits of the Class of Contract Code. See the table in the Note.

info.note: If the new plan's Class of Contract Code is not specified in the SR activity you are working from, see RMO Plan Strategy ID and Class of Contract Code - Overview for a complete list of plan strategy IDs cross-referenced with plan names and class of contract codes.

entry.ph: Last Two Digits of Class of Contract Code

substep.cmd: Class of Contract Code: Enter the 16 digit Class of Contract Code for the new plan.
Other Dental QHP: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
QHP Sign Date: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Carrier: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Disability Affecting Communication: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Communication Materials Needed: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.
Policy Should be Mailed: Copy the value from the previous coverage. Switch to Window One to see that.

step.cmd: Click Add and Exit.
In the Display InActive? field, click Yes, and then click Do Search. The member record displays.
For each dependent on the policy, repeat steps 35 (right-clicking on the dependent's name) through 50.
Right-click on the member's name.
Hover over Drill Down.
Click Ancillary Rate Info. The Ancillary Rate Records displays.
Verify that there is an active ancillary rate record.

info.note: If there is not an Ancillary Rate Record, send an email to the Retail Market Operations - Rate Administration mailbox with the member's ID and which LOB needs an Ancillary Rate Record.

step.cmd: In the Display InActive? field, click Yes, and then click Do Search.
For each dependent on the policy, repeat steps 52 (right-clicking on the dependent's name) through 56.
Right-click the member's name.
Hover over Drill Down.
Click All Details.
Reinstate the funding assignment:

substep.cmd: Under Member Funding Assignments, find the funding assignment that was terminated when you cancelled the previous coverage. (It has a Thru date of today.)
Right-click the funding assignment you identified in the previous sub-step, and then click Modify.
In the Termination Date field, type 12/31/9999.
Click Modify & Exit.

step.cmd: Reinstate the subsidy (if there is one):

substep.cmd: Under Subsidy Maintenance, look for a subsidy record that was terminated when you cancelled the previous coverage. (It has an ending date of today.) If you do not find one, skip the rest of these sub-steps and go to step 63.
Right-click the subsidy record you identified in the previous sub-step, and then click Modify.
In the Subsidy Termination Date field, type 12/31/9999.
Click Modify & Exit.

step.cmd: Reinstate brokers (if any):

substep.cmd: Under Broker Assignments, look for one or more brokers who were terminated when you cancelled the previous coverage. (They have a to date of today.) If you do not find one, skip the rest of these sub-steps and go to step 64.
For each broker you identified in the previous sub-step, right-click the broker record, and then click Modify.
In the Termination Date field, type 12/31/9999.
Click Modify & Exit.

step.cmd: In the Member Search panel, click Close All.

info.note: In the dialog that appears, click No.

step.cmd: Request a new Policy Kit for the member.

substep.cmd: Click the ID card icon in the member's row of the Matching Members list.
Complete the request window as shown in the table below.

row.entry: Leave set to the member's ID number.
Leave set to the Primary Insured.
Leave set to the member's Group ID.
If available, select the latest provider effective date.
Select the case number of the new coverage.
Leave set to the Primary Insured's Mailing address.
Leave set to M-Member Only (No cards are sent with the Policy Kit.)
Click the effective date of the active coverage. (No cards are sent with the Policy Kit.)
If No Address Then Send to
Leave set to Blue Cross Blue Shield. (No cards are sent with the Policy Kit.)
Request will be sent to fields
If not automatically populated, type the name and address information for where the kit will be sent.

info.note: Do not type anything in the Message field. That field is for system messages to you; information you type there is not saved or sent to anyone.

substep.cmd: Click Accept & Order.
Close the request window.

step.cmd: Click the left-most set of double yellow arrows (>>). The Customer Service inquiry panel opens.
Click Finish Inquiry. The CS Inquiry Completion window appears.
Click Closed on First Contact.
Select Send to Subscriber.
Click the box beside the member ID of the subscriber.
In the Comment field, enter the number of the SR that was opened for the request.
Follow the RMO Workaround Creating Free Form Correspondence in CUI procedure to create and send a confirmation letter to the member.
Follow the RMO Requesting ID Cards in VUI procedure to order new ID cards for the member.
If the plan change was retroactive, send an activity to Claims telling them to check for claims that need adjusting as a result of the plan change.

substep.cmd: In the SR opened for this transaction, create a new activity.
In the Comments field of the activity, type “Re-examine claims due to plan change”, the member's ID number, and the effective date of the new plan.
In the Activity Code 1 field, type PLC.
In the Employee ID field, type UHUBENP.
Click Save.

step.cmd: If the plan change was retroactive, send an activity to FinOps telling them to reinvoice the member.

substep.cmd: In the SR opened for this transaction, create a new activity.
In the Comments field of the activity, type “Reinvoice due to plan change”, the member's ID number, and the effective date of the new plan.
In the Activity Code 1 field, type PLC.
In the Employee ID field, type UFINOPS.
Click Save.

step.cmd: In the SR opened for this transaction, in the activity directing the plan change, set the activity's status to Done.
